segmentation_cropping module¶

Module containing all functions concerning the application of the segmenation models and the use of the predicted coordinates for cropping the labels.

class segmentation_cropping.Predict_Labels(path_to_model, classes, jpg_dir, threshold=0.8)[source]¶

Bases: object

class_prediction(model)[source]¶

Uses the trained model created by Detecto and tries to predict the labelling of all files in a directory. It then returns a Pandas Dataframe.

Parameters:

model (detecto.core.Model) – access to object detection model and pretrained PyTorch model (fasterrcnn_resnet50_fpn).

Returns:

pandas Dataframe with the results.

Return type:

DataFrame

clean_predictions(dataframe, out_dir=None)[source]¶

Creates a clean dataframe only with boxes´ coordinates exceeding a given threshold score.

Parameters:

DataFrame (pandas.DataFrame) – Pandas Dataframe with predicted coordinates and labels’ scores.

Returns:

Pandas Dataframe with the trimmed results.

Return type:

DataFrame

get_model()[source]¶

Call trained object detection model, for example model_labels_class.pth. The model was trained with the Detecto python package which is built on top of PyTorch.

Returns:

trained object detection model.

Return type:

model

segmentation_cropping.create_crops(jpg_dir, dataframe, out_dir='/home/leonardo/to_save/Projects/Museum_for_Natural_history/ocr_to_data/python-label_processing/docs')[source]¶

Creates crops by using the csv from applying the model and the original pictures inside a directory.

Parameters:

  • jpg_dir (str) – path to directory with jpgs.

  • dataframe (str) – path to csv file.

  • out_dir (str) – path to the target directory to save the cropped jpgs.

segmentation_cropping.create_dirs(dataframe, path)[source]¶

Creates for every class a seperate directory.

Parameters:

  • dataframe (pandas.Dataframe) – dataframe containig the classes as a column

  • path (str) – path of chosen directory

segmentation_cropping.crop_picture(img_raw, path, filename, pic_class, **coordinates)[source]¶

Crops the picture using the given coordinates.

Parameters:

  • img_raw (numpy matrix) – input jpg converted to numpy matrix by cv2.

  • path (str) – path where the picture should be saved.

  • filename (str) – name of the picture.

segmentation_cropping.load_dataframe(filepath_csv)[source]¶

Loads the csv file using Pandas.

Parameters:

filepath_csv (str) – string containing the path to the csv with the results from applying the model.

Returns:

The csv as a Pandas Dataframe

Return type:

Dataframe

segmentation_cropping.load_jpgs(filepath)[source]¶

Loads the jpg file using the opencv module.

Returns:

cv2 image object

Return type:

Mat

segmentation_cropping.make_file_name(label_id, pic_class, occurence)[source]¶

Creates a fitting filename.

Parameters:

  • label_id (str) – string containing the label id.

  • pic_class (str) – class of the label.

  • occurence (int) – counts how many times the label class already occured in the picture.
